      • Generator

        public void Generator(java.lang.String network,
                      java.lang.String server,
                      java.lang.String rpcUsername,
                      java.lang.String rpcPassword)
        Generate BitcoinClient
        Parameters:
        network - "testnet", "mainnet", "regtest"
        server - Inet4address and port, i.e. "http://192.168.1.38:18332"
        rpcUsername - rpcuser in bitcoin.conf (in full node)
        rpcPassword - rpcpassword in bitcoin.conf (in full node)

      • getUTxOFromTxO

        public UTxOOBj getUTxOFromTxO(org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutput txO)

      • create2of3MultiSigRedeemScript

        public static org.bitcoinj.script.Script create2of3MultiSigRedeemScript(org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey clientPubKey_1,
                                                                        org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey clientPubKey_2,
                                                                        org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey serverPubKey)
        Return the redeem script which is created from 2 client public keys and 1 server public key. This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. Use the redeem script to create the multisig address and signature script, estimate the fee. To export public key from ECKey, we can use method: ECKey.getPubKey(): byte[] To import public key, we can use function: ECKey.fromPublicOnly(byte[] pub): ECKey IMPORTANT: The script created from (A,B,C) is different from the one created from (B,A,C). So remember the order of the public keys.
        Parameters:
        clientPubKey_1 - the first client public key
        clientPubKey_2 - the second client public key
        serverPubKey - the server public key
        Returns:
        the redeem script created from 3 public keys

      • create2of3MultiSigAddress

        public static org.bitcoinj.core.Address create2of3MultiSigAddress(org.bitcoinj.core.NetworkParameters params,
                                                                  org.bitcoinj.script.Script script2of3MultiSigRedeem)
        Return the address which is created from the redeem script. This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. Use the address to be able to receive coins from other addresses.
        Parameters:
        params - the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...)
        script2of3MultiSigRedeem - the redeem script
        Returns:
        the address created from the redeem script

      • create2of3MultiSigRawTx

        public static org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction create2of3MultiSigRawTx(org.bitcoinj.core.NetworkParameters params,
                                                                    java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.core.TransactionOutput> unspentTxOutputs,
                                                                    org.bitcoinj.script.Script script2of3MultiSigRedeem,
                                                                    java.util.List<org.springframework.data.util.Pair<org.bitcoinj.core.Address,org.bitcoinj.core.Coin>> candidates,
                                                                    org.bitcoinj.core.Coin feePerKb)
                                                             throws org.bitcoinj.core.InsufficientMoneyException
        Return the raw transaction which has transaction outputs and unsigned transaction inputs This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. IMPORTANT: 1 KB = 1000 bytes RECOMMENDED: feePerKb = Coin.valueOf(1000) 1000 satoshis/KB
        Parameters:
        params - the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...)
        unspentTxOutputs - the list of unspent transaction outputs
        script2of3MultiSigRedeem - the redeem script
        candidates - the list of pairs which Coin is the amount we want to send to Address
        feePerKb - the price of transaction (fee per KB)
        Returns:
        the raw transaction
        Throws:
        org.bitcoinj.core.InsufficientMoneyException - when the input sum is not enough to send, it will throw this exception

      • create2of3MultiSigRawTxHash

        public static java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.core.Sha256Hash> create2of3MultiSigRawTxHash(org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction rawTx,
                                                                                       org.bitcoinj.script.Script script2of3MultiSigRedeem)
        Return the list of transaction hashes. This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. To be able to send the transaction, the client MUST sign them.
        Parameters:
        rawTx - the raw transaction after created by the create2of3MultiSigRawTx function.
        script2of3MultiSigRedeem - the redeem script
        Returns:
        the list of transaction hashes

      • create2of3MultiSigTxSig

        public static java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.crypto.TransactionSignature> create2of3MultiSigTxSig(java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.core.Sha256Hash> rawTxHashes,
                                                                                               org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey privKey)
        Return the list of transaction signatures. This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the client side. After receiving the list of transaction hashes, the client MUST sign them to create the list of transaction signatures. After signing them, the client MUST send the list of the signatures to the server. To export private key from ECKey, we can use method: ECKey.getPrivateKeyEncoded(NetworkParameters params).toBase58(): String with: NetworkParameters params: the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...) To import private key, we can use function: DumpedPrivateKey.fromBase58(NetworkParameters params, String base58): ECKey with: NetworkParameters params: the network parameter (MainNet, TestNet, ...) String base58: the private key in String format
        Parameters:
        rawTxHashes - the list of transaction hashes
        privKey - the private key
        Returns:
        the list of transaction signatures.

      • signRaw2of3MultiSigTransaction

        public static org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction signRaw2of3MultiSigTransaction(org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction rawTx,
                                                                           org.bitcoinj.script.Script script2of3MultiSigRedeem,
                                                                           java.util.List<org.bitcoinj.crypto.TransactionSignature> userTxSign,
                                                                           org.bitcoinj.core.ECKey serverKey)
        Complete the transaction. This is the 2-of-3 multisig. Use at the server side. After receiving the list of transaction signatures, the server will add them and complete the transaction. IMPORTANT: Complete the transaction, but not send the transaction to the network. To send the transaction to the network, use the method: BitcoinClient.sendRawTransaction(Transaction tx): Sha256Hash
        Parameters:
        rawTx - the raw transaction
        script2of3MultiSigRedeem - the redeem script
        userTxSign - the list of transaction signatures
        serverKey - the server private key
        Returns:
        the completed transaction
